Olivier Giroud Player Profile Free £10 bet on football Follow us on Twitter The latest football news Football Transfer Centre Related Content Olivier Giroud: 'Now I want to do more' Arsenal striker Olivier Giroud feels ready to take his game to another level. Last Updated: December 17 2012, 7:55 GMT Giroud wants to take next step Giroud Wants To Take Next Step News/ Football/
textAfterTable: *Current Season The France international looks set to return from a back problem to boost the Gunners' attacking options for Monday night's trip to Barclays Premier League strugglers Reading. Giroud took some time to settle following his summer move from Montpellier, where he had been Ligue 1's joint top-scorer last season to help his team win an historic first championship. The 26-year-old has produced some consistent performances despite not scoring since the 5-2 win over Tottenham on November 17, and is hungry to continue his improvement. "It has been an interesting few months, but now I want to do more - I am an Arsenal player and rightly expectations are high," Giroud said in an interview with the official Arsenal matchday programme. "I am trying to do what the boss asks of me, to put pressure on defenders and to improve on protecting and holding the ball. "We put a lot of good crosses in, so it is important that I get on the end of them and score. I am feeling better and better in this team all the time - I know my team-mates now and things are more automated on the pitch, which makes things easier for me." Gunners boss Arsene Wenger takes his beleaguered squad to Madejski Stadium in need of a confidence boost following the shock penalty shoot-out defeat at npower League Two Bradford.
